result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Perles A Terry

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Perles A Terry in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Perles A Terry.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.
Defense requests adjournment for reasons set forth in the record. Court grants defense's request.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Perles A Terry appeared by video.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes appeared by video for Perles A Terry.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a final pre-trial. Case is no longer in trial posture for reasons placed on the record. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Court vacates the scheduled jury trial. 
Case adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
States Witness List, received and filed.
Received and filed: STATE'S Requested Jury Instructions
Received and filed: STATE'S MOTION IN LIMINE

Defendant Perles A Terry in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Case adjourned to Br. 30.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DST and DDT. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Perles A Terry in court.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/25/2022@1p
